contents: <sup>1</sup>Oxidation is a chemical reaction that causes a substance to gain oxygen. <sup>2</sup>One _________ example of oxidation and reduction occurs during the extraction of iron from ore. <sup>3</sup>In this process, iron oxide reacts with carbon monoxide. <sup>4</sup>The iron oxide loses oxygen molecules, resulting in iron. <sup>5</sup>The carbon monoxide gains oxygen molecules, resulting in carbon dioxide. <sup>6</sup>The most common type of oxidation that people recognize is rust formation on iron exposed to water. <sup>7</sup>This oxidation is the result of an electrochemical process that ultimately leads to unprotected iron gaining oxygen molecules and becoming iron oxide, or rust. <sup>8</sup>When one substance is oxidized, another substance loses oxygen, a process called reduction.
